channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024010107
item.description:
Report E-2024010107

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN2929 Sulfix 9272 Scavenger release from (2) 330-gallon poly totes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 70-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor and a 20’ x 20’ area of the asphalt lot below. The totes were punctured by metal sticking out from the trailer wall. Each tote was transferred into two new totes for shipment on. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly, (3) 55-gallon metal, and (3) 95-gallon poly drums. The two damaged totes were then cut up and containerized into (1) 95-gallon poly and (1) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2024010111

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: AURORA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAU experienced a UN2874 Enviroset 40E FNB Resin release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 5’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor due to a faulty leaking seal on the 55-gallon metal drum. The drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: NOTIFIED BY DRIVER SUPERVISOR, OF A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE IN PACKAGE CAR ON ROAD. RESPONDER ACQUIRED LEAKING PACKAGE DECISION TREE, AND DONNED REQUIRED PPE. INSPECTION OF HAZMAT PACKAGE, REVEALED PACKAGE CONTENTS TO BE A CORROSIVE. RESPONDER USED CORROSIVE SOLIDS / LIQUIDS RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP SPILLAGE ON PACKAGE CAR FLOOR. RESPONDER TRANSPORTED CONTAINERIZE HAZMAT PACKAGE AND ABSORBED MATERIAL BACK TO THE SERVICE CENTER DMP AREA IN LINED SPILL TRAYS FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a release from 24 boxes of UN1824 Mechanical Warewash Detergent each containing 1.5-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete spill cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2.5-gallons of product released in total to a 6’ x 12’ area of the trailer floor due to load shift/improper loading. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged boxes of product were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: HAZARDOUS MATERIAL WAS DISCOVERED AT THE AIR TRAILER. EMPLOYEE WAS REMOVING THE SHIPPING PAPERS FROM THE POUCH AND NOTICED THAT THE PAIL WAS LEAKING INTO THE POUCH. EMPLOYEE WASHED HANDS FOR APPROPRIATE TIME AS STATE IN THE SAFETY DATA SHEET. RESPONDER NOTICED A PUNCTURE HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE PAIL NEAR THE SHIPPING PAPERS POUCH. PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED AND BROUGHT TO THE DMP USING THE DECISON TREE FOR OXIDIZER LIQUIDS. DAMAGE WAS THEN PROCESSED USING THE DECISION TREE FOR OXIDIZERS.

  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Car found to be leaking from the bottom outlet cap at a rate of 2-3 gallons per minute. Upon arrival of the contractor, Code 3, the valve handle was in the closed, pinned, and sealed position and the bottom outlet cap was less than tool tight. Code 3 tightened the cap, stopping the release. After the car was set out, the contractor was able to climb under the car and determined that the valve was in the open position even with the handle closed. The handle was dropped to the open position, engaged, and the valve closed. The BOV plug was removed and verified the valve was closed with no release. The shipper was contacted and an OTMA was requested before the car would be released into transportation.

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 70ft-by-20ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that seventy (70) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area while on SCBA and later respirators and later once the neutralizing had been completed an absorbent was used to gather the spent material. Hepaco personnel recovered the spent material and containerized it into eight (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred to a new tote and the damaged 275-gallon poly tote was cut up and placed into one (1) 55- gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023120322
item.description:
Report E-2023120322

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-16
  • City: PARKERSBURG
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 16, 2023, at approximately 14:24 hours, personnel at the CSX Parkersburg, WV yard reported an odor of gas coming from the area of tank TILX 305535, residue: last contained Isoprene, stabilized. SPSI, a CSXT response contractor, responded and found TILX 305535 leaking from the top of the tank car. The tank car was isolated and the Shipper, Kraton Corp, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2023-1216-00057). SPSI inspected the railcar and found the sample line valve not fully closed and the secondary closure plug less than tool tight. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Kel Fann (904-239-2238, Michael.Fann@kraton.com). Contractor personnel closed the sample line valve and secured the secondary closure plug. The car was released for transportation.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-10T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-29
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 29, 2023, one (1) 300-gallon tote of NA1993 was damaged during loading and released approximately 150-gallons of product to the trailer interior, pavement below, and the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. TPM personnel deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor, dock floor and pavement below trailer and worked them in utilizing hand tools. Crews then utilized a vacuum pump to transfer the virgin product from the damaged tote to a new tote and secured for normal transport. All NA1993 impacted material was collected and containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums and RLC personnel took possession of the four (4) 55-gallon drums and one (1) damaged 275-gallon tote to be added to the facility waste stream.

  • Description: On December 27, 2023, one (1) 375-gallon tote of UN2693 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one hundred (100) gallons of product to the trailer interior, pavement beneath the trailer, and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from LoneStar Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN2693-impacted trailer, dock floor, and asphalt parking lot and swept them in utilizing hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal. LSH personnel transferred the product from the damaged 330-gallon tote to one (1) new 330-gallon tote for further shipment.

  • Description: The shipment was dropped off over the counter. It was later discovered that it was emitting a strong odor. The outer box contained 2 fiberboard boxes. One box contained one metal can. The second box contained 2 metal cans. All 3 metal cans were wrapped in paper, emitting an odor and was cold to the touch. All 3 metal bottles are labelled UN 3334, Class 9, PG III (2-(4-methylthiazol-5-yl)ethyl acetate), Lot#275, PO# EUN-3205RI05. The shipment is being held for FAA investigation.

  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 21, 2023, at 1945 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of a total of (2) quarts of SHIELD-BRITE ® VACATE (UN1719 Caustic Alkali Liquids, n.o.s. (Sodium Hydroxide, Potassium Hydroxide) 8, II) from (6) 5-gallon plastic pails. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by defective seals in the caps on top of the pails and contained to a 5’ x 6’ area on the trailer floor. Contractors were able to neutralize the release and clean it with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, and recovered product was placed in (2) 55-gallon DF's and then taken offsite by contractors.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NCH experienced a UN2735 PRE-TECT 2040HP release from a 2700-pound metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-gallons of product released to the concrete dock floor and pads in a 2’ x 3’ area over the course of 2 weeks while awaiting a new tote for transfer. The release was caused by a steam leaking on the bottom fitting which was secured and contained on the dock. Once the new tote arrived onsite on 12/28/2023, the material was transferred for shipment on. All impacted pads, absorbents, and PPE were containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2024010048

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-24
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE HANDLING OF AN AIR DECLARED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL PACKAGE CONTAINING HYDROCHLORIC ACID, THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE BURST OPEN SPILLING THE INNER DANGEROUS GOOD CONTENTS. VAPORS AND FUMES BEGAN RELEASING CAUSING ONE WING OF THE FACILITY TO BE TEMPORARILY EVACUATED. OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED TO RESPOND TO THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE CONTAINED 6 X 2.5 L GLASS BOTTLES OF HYDROCHLORIC ACID. TWO BOTTLES SHATTERED UPON HITTING THE CONCRETE FLOOR. THE BOTTLES MADE CONTACT WITH THE RIGHT SHIN AND FOOT OF THE PACKAGE HANDLER. EMPLOYEE REMOVED THE AFFECTED CLOTHING AND WAS SENT TO CONCENTRA URGENT CARE AS A PRECAUTIONARY MEASURE FOR POSSIBLE EXPOSURE. AFTER EXAMINATION THE EMPLOYEE WAS CLEARED TO RETURN TO WORK. A SECOND AIR DECLARED PACKAGE CONTAINING UN1090, ACETONE, PG II ALSO APPEARED TO BE LEAKING UNDER TRACKING 1Z18131X0101754877. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING ACCOUNT NUMBER 18131X, SPECTRUM LABORATORY PROD INC. 769 JERSEY AVE. NEW BRUNSWICK NJ 08901.

THE BATTERY PACK IS MODEL A2042 USED FOR APPLE IPOD PRO 11-INCH BATTERY REPLACEMENT. THE BOX ALSO CONTAINS ELEVEN NON-REGULATED 11-INCH SCREEN REPLACEMENTS WITHOUT LITHIUM BATTERIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A LITHIUM ION BATTERY WAS SHIPPING IN THE AIR NETWORK. THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON A UPS FLIGHT FROM (CGN) COLOGNE, GERMANY TO DISCOVERY LOCATION (WAS) WARSAW, POLAND PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED LITHIUM BATTERY DISCOVERY. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT B56671, GREAT THINKERS HOLDING BV, HERCULES 6, GILZE 5126RK, NETHERLANDS.

  • Description: On November 21, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum of corrosive liquid was crushed and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and cleaners to remediate the site. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum. TLE placed the two (2) damaged 30-gallon drums into two (2) 55-gallon drums. All freight was re-secured and staged for further processing and shipping.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 15, 2023, at 1145 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Schneider personnel in Caraopolis, Pennsylvania regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of Interox Hydrogen Peroxide Chemical Grade 50% (UN2014, 5.1, 8, II) from a tanker truck. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to a small area of soil beneath the pump. Contractors were able to recover the impacted area using only hand tools. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum which was staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • Description: On 11/22/23, the UTLX 205951 was found in the Barstow railyard to be leaking methanol from the top of the car. Hazmat responders isolated the car and the inspection revealed liquid leaking through the packing stem. The valve was found in the partially open position and was missing the packing retainer nut. The valve and release were secured with a pin. On 11/30/23, Graymar Env returned to further secure the valve by adding a packing sleeve and retainer nut. The car was pressure tested to verify integrity of repairs. No leaks were found. Shipper advised of need to get OTMA for movement to destination.

  • Description: On 10.4.23 at approximately 7:45am, during a transfer of Ferric Chloride from railcar(PVSX213032) into All-Chem trailer (FRP64) the air valve on the trailer malfunctioned causing a release. The loader immediately climbed down from the railcar and closed both the internal and external valves on the trailer. Approximately 2 gallons of product was released, notifications were made to proper NS, RSI, PVS and All-Chem personnel. Hepaco arrived on site around 12pm, cleaned up, removed all debris and departed around 2:15pm.
